column4: i installed ubuntu on a 500mhz p3 with 256 ram, once i get past gdm it begins to load nautilus, the screen flashes and kicks back to gdm
what video card?
voodoo
google around, you may need to install voodoo modules?
i also have an unconfigured pvr-350
make sure your xorg.conf has the right driver as well
should i rip out the tv-card?
shouldn't be the tv-card's fault
/var/log/Xorg.0.log usually
pastebin your Xorg error log, should have info on why it dun work
thanks lemme run upstairs brb
you may want to try visiting #xorg
after reading the xorg.conf and the var/log/Xorg.0, i found and removed all of the wacom input devices from the xorg.conf
it booted and i was able to open a file manager, but it then failed when the background was drawn to the screen
the only error in the var/log was "error opening security policy file /usr/lib/xserve/SecurityPolicy"
u are using the voodoo driver, right?
yes it properly detected my drivers
not sure then. google around for xorg voodoo
could the problem be my voodoo card doesnt support dri which glx needs
if so, is there an easy way to uninstall xgl
u could comment DRI out.. ask in #xorg
i solved the video card problem, but alas a new one arises, after finally loading nautilus the mouse disappears
